lead_paragraph: A lawyer for Chris Benoit’s personal doctor suggested in court papers that Benoit, the former professional wrestler who killed his wife, his son and himself in June, had a hormone disorder that justified the amount of steroids he was prescribed.The doctor, Phil Astin, has pleaded not guilty to federal charges of improperly prescribing drugs to two patients other than Benoit. In a motion to suppress evidence filed yesterday, Astin’s lawyer, Manny Arora, said that “the amount of medication in question was not excessive and would be medically appropriate based on the medical condition of Mr. Benoit.”.
